alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 7:08AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Cabarrus County in the piedmont of North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Streams throughout the Rocky River Headwaters will continue to rise this morning due to excess runoff from earlier heavy rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 702 AM EDT, Watch for developing flooding along Back Creek near Pharr Mill Rd, Robinson Church Rd and Stallings Rd. Flooding along Rocky River Road and Sequoia Hill Road will develop as the morning wears on, and possibly encroach Poplar Tent Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
